rooms.description: A spacious entrance hall with a living area that follows Scandinavian minimalism and natural lighting, designed to provide an inviting space with Vastu principles for positive energy flow.
A cozy master bedroom integrated on the ground floor. Incorporates soft pastel colors and efficient storage solutions while aligning with Vastu principles of sleep direction.
A compact guest bedroom designed for occasional visitors. Features minimal furniture and ample natural light as per Scandinavian design aesthetics.
Dedicated servant quarters located on the ground floor to adhere to local building norms. Designed for privacy and comfort within budget constraints.
A dedicated home office space that doubles as a study area, designed with natural lighting and ergonomic furniture to foster productivity.
Modern kitchen adhering to Scandinavian design principles. Efficient layout for budget-friendly renovations using locally available materials.
A functional bathroom designed with simple finishes and easy-to-clean surfaces to maintain a minimalist aesthetic.

openings.description: Large entry door for natural light ingress and ease of access, aligned with Vastu to promote positive energy flow.
Ample window openings on the east side for morning sunlight, enhancing the Scandinavian minimalist design.

rooms.description: An expansive open-plan studio area for relaxation and entertainment on the first floor. Integrates Scandinavian design with functional space usage.
A dedicated space that can serve as a private study or art studio, designed for creative pursuits and work on a tight budget using multifunctional furniture.

openings.description: Balcony overlooking the garden area that provides an extension of living space and adheres to Vastu principles by connecting with nature.
A staircase designed to be both functional and aesthetically pleasing, providing seamless transition between floors with minimalistic details.

building_narrative: This design outlines a Scandinavian, two-story studio apartment villa on a 60x90 feet plot. The plan respects local building norms by incorporating dedicated servant quarters and aligns with Vastu principles to promote positive energy flow. Budget considerations have been prioritized through the use of minimalistic Scandinavian aesthetics, multifunctional spaces, and locally sourced materials.
